item.title: Jakarta EE Specification Process
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Version 1.2. Effective July 16, 2019 The Jakarta EE Specification Process (JESP) is concerned with the Specification Process as it applies to Specification Projects operating under the purview of the Jakarta EE Working Group. The Jakarta EE Specification Committee hereby adopts the Eclipse Foundation Specification Process v1.2 (EFSP) as the Jakarta EE Specification Process with the following modifications: Any modification to or revision of this Jakarta EE Specification Process, including the adoption of a new version of the EFSP, must be approved by a Super-majority of the Specification Committee, including a Super-majority of the Strategic Members of the Jakarta EE Working Group, in addition to any other ballot requirements set forth in the EFSP.

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Last Updated: December 1, 2020 Table of contents What is Jakarta EE? What is the significance of the name “Jakarta EE”? How did you come up with the name? What is included in the Jakarta EE platform? What happened with javax.* namespace? What is the status of the Java EE TCKs? How does the Jakarta EE governance model differ from Java EE governance model? What is the process used for creating new specifications?
